about.title: About Ceyara Tours
about.description: We are passionate about showcasing the incredible beauty and rich cultural heritage of Sri Lanka. Our carefully crafted tours offer authentic experiences that connect you with the heart and soul of this magnificent island.
about.description1: Ceyara Tours specializes in creating magical memories and bespoke experiences that offer profound insight into the rich tapestry of Sri Lanka's vibrant culture, stunning landscapes, and hidden treasures.
about.description2: Our commitment is to provide you with a personalized story, not just a trip. We guide you through secluded beaches to ancient temples, from lush rainforests to bustling markets, creating magical memories that stand the test of time.
about.planTrip: PLAN YOUR TRIP TO SRI LANKA

anuradhapuraDayTour.introDescription: Go deep into Sri Lankan history with an Anuradhapura Day Tour. Explore the ancient city that served as the capital of Sri Lanka for over 1,300 years. Discover magnificent dagobas, ancient monasteries, and the sacred Bodhi tree, one of the oldest historically documented trees in the world.

detailedDescription.intro: Anuradhapura is a UNESCO World Heritage Site recognized for its well-preserved historical ruins dating back to the 4th century BC - 11th century AD. It served as the capital of Sri Lanka during this period and was a significant center of Theravada Buddhism for many centuries. Known as one of the oldest inhabited cities globally, Anuradhapura is located approximately 205 km north of Colombo, in the North Central Province of Sri Lanka. The city attracts millions of tourists to its ancient ruins, featuring massive dagobas, crumbling temples, giant brick towers, and archaic pools. Current sites are mostly used as temples and holy places, requiring respect from visitors.

historicalPoints.4thCenturyBC: 4th Century BC: Became the capital of ancient Lanka during the reign of King Pandukhabaya.
historicalPoints.3rdCenturyBC: 3rd Century BC (Buddhism Introduction): Buddhism was introduced during the reign of King Devanampiyatissa.
historicalPoints.kingTissaFirstStupa: King Tissa's First Stupa: Built the country's first Stupa to house the relic of Buddha's right collarbone.
historicalPoints.sacredBoSapling: Sacred Bo Sapling: King Tissa also planted the sacred Bo Sapling, brought by Princess Sangamitta (daughter of Indian Emperor Asoka). This tree is considered the oldest living tree in the world.
historicalPoints.kingTissaIrrigation: King Tissa's Irrigation: Built irrigation tanks and a man-made lake (still in use today) for inland agriculture.
historicalPoints.end3rdCenturyBC: End of 3rd Century BC (King Mahasena): Built 16 irrigation tanks and the tallest stupa, Jethavanaramaya.
historicalPoints.2ndCenturyBC: 2nd Century BC (King Dutugemunu): Successfully recaptured the city from invading Indian armies.
historicalPoints.kingDutugemunuConstruction: King Dutugemunu's Construction Boost: His reign saw massive construction, including Ruwanweliseya Stupa, Mirisavetiya Temple, and the Brazen Temple.

jetavanaramaDagoba.title: Jetavanarama Dagoba
jetavanaramaDagoba.description: Constructed in the 3rd century by King Mahasena, this massive stupa originally stood over 100 meters tall, making it one of the tallest structures of its time.

isurumuniyaVihara.title: Isurumuniya Vihara
isurumuniyaVihara.description: A rock temple renowned for its intricate carvings, including the famous "Lovers" sculpture, dating back to the 3rd century BC.

thuparamaDagoba.title: Thuparama Dagoba
thuparamaDagoba.description: Built in the 3rd century BC by King Devanampiya Tissa, it is the oldest dagoba in Sri Lanka and is said to enshrine the right collarbone of the Buddha.

kuttamPokuna.title: Kuttam Pokuna
kuttamPokuna.description: These twin bathing ponds, constructed between the 8th and 10th centuries, showcase advanced hydraulic engineering and were used by monks for ritual baths.

mirisavatiyaDagoba.title: Mirisavatiya Dagoba
mirisavatiyaDagoba.description: Built by King Dutugemunu after his victory over King Elara, this stupa was constructed on the spot where the king's scepter, containing a relic of the Buddha, was enshrined.

ruwanwalisayaDagoba.title: Ruwanwalisaya Dagoba
ruwanwalisayaDagoba.description: Constructed in the 2nd century BC by King Dutugemunu, this stupa is renowned for its perfect "bubble" shape and is one of the most revered Buddhist monuments in Sri Lanka.

abhayagiriDagoba.title: Abhayagiri Dagoba
abhayagiriDagoba.description: Established in the 1st century BC, this massive stupa was part of a monastery that housed 5,000 monks and was a center for both Mahayana and Theravada Buddhism.

sriMahaBodhi.title: Sri Maha Bodhi
sriMahaBodhi.description: A sacred fig tree grown from a cutting of the original Bodhi tree under which the Buddha attained enlightenment, making it one of the oldest living trees with a known planting date.

belihuloyaDayTour.title: Belihuloya Day Tour
belihuloyaDayTour.description: The fortunate geographical location of Belihuloya links the wet and dry zones of the island at an altitude of less than 1500m. As a result‚Ä¶

colomboDayTour.title: Day Tour of Colombo
colomboDayTour.description: This ancient heritage reflects on the city today in terms of its architecture consisting of colonial buildings as well as high rise sky scrapers and shopping malls.

galleDayTour.title: Galle Day Tour
galleDayTour.description: The Galle Fort was built by the Portuguese, fortified later by the Dutch and is well preserved till today. In addition to the Portuguese and Dutch remains‚Ä¶

geoffreyBawaWorksSriLanka.title: Geoffrey Bawa Works in Sri Lanka
geoffreyBawaWorksSriLanka.description: When the late Geoffrey Manning Bawa entered the world of architecture, he made his mark with every design he produced. Exploring modernism and its cultural implications‚Ä¶

hotAirBallooningDayTour.title: Hot Air Ballooning Day Tour
hotAirBallooningDayTour.description: Enjoy an experience of a lifetime as you feel the adrenaline rush while drifting off over breathtaking views of the tropical paradise of Sri Lanka.

kandyDayTour.title: Kandy Day Tour
kandyDayTour.description: Kandy, more popularly known as the hill capital of Sri Lanka, is an attractive tourist destination. Its history dates back to the 15th century‚Ä¶

kithulgalaWhiteWaterRafting.title: Kithulgala White Water Rafting
kithulgalaWhiteWaterRafting.description: The town of Kitulgala is where this tour will take you for a day filled with extreme adventure. Kitulgala is a small, yet beautiful town located in a wet zone rain forest‚Ä¶

littleEnglandDayTour.title: Little England Day Tour
littleEnglandDayTour.description: Nuwara Eliya, also known as Sri Lanka's "Little England", is the prime hill resort of the country. At a height of approximately 2000m above sea level‚Ä¶

negomboLagoonFishingDayTour.title: Negombo Lagoon Fishing Day Tour
negomboLagoonFishingDayTour.description: Along the West Coast of Sri Lanka is the friendly city of Negombo, one of the oldest fishing towns in the country. In addition to its centuries-old fishing industry‚Ä¶

polonnaruwaDayTour.title: Polonnaruwa Day Tour
polonnaruwaDayTour.description: Being the second-largest kingdom in Sri Lanka, the ancient city of Polonnaruwa has much in store for archaeologists, history lovers‚Ä¶

sigiriyaDambullaDayTour.title: Sigiriya & Dambulla Day Tour
sigiriyaDambullaDayTour.description: Sigiriya, an ancient palace, was once nominated as the 8th wonder of the world. Today, Sigiriya and Dambulla are a UNESCO recognized heritage site and a major tourist attraction.

sinharajaDayTour.title: Sinharaja Day Tour
sinharajaDayTour.description: UNESCO World Heritage site since 1988. Currently, the reserve spans 8864 hectares and the country plans to quadruple the size of the area to respect the ecological significance of the region.

udawalaweNationalParkDayTour.title: Udawalawe National Park Day Tour
udawalaweNationalParkDayTour.description: This park is the third most visited park in all of Sri Lanka and presents visitors with a fusion of flora and fauna. Herds of elephants, buffalos, deer‚Ä¶

whaleWatchingDayTour.title: Whale Watching Day Tour
whaleWatchingDayTour.description: Sri Lanka is one of the best destinations for whale watching in Asia. Sperm Whales and Blue Whales are a common occurrence off the southern coast‚Ä¶

yalaNationalParkDayTour.title: Yala National Park Day Tour
yalaNationalParkDayTour.description: Have you ever been on a safari in a jungle that is ruled by the leopards? The Yala National Park is your answer! With 130,000 hectares of landscape‚Ä¶

wilpattuNationalParkDayTour.title: Wilpattu National Park Day Tour
wilpattuNationalParkDayTour.description: For your day tour of Wilpattu National Park, you will be taken on a jeep safari around the park to spot Sri Lanka's wild animals such as elephants, jackal, sloth bear, leopard

We provide personalized services, crafting ideal itineraries based on individual preferences, and ensure comfortable journeys with luxury vehicles and top-tier accommodations. Whether you're on a honeymoon or traveling with family or friends, we guarantee a luxurious and memorable Sri Lankan experience.

anuradhapuraDayTour.title: Anuradhapura Day Tour
anuradhapuraDayTour.description: Explore the ancient capital of Sri Lanka, a UNESCO World Heritage Site with magnificent dagobas, ancient ruins, and the sacred Sri Maha Bodhi tree.
anuradhapuraDayTour.introDescription: Explore the ancient capital of Sri Lanka, a UNESCO World Heritage Site with magnificent dagobas, ancient ruins, and the sacred Sri Maha Bodhi tree.

detailedDescription.intro: Anuradhapura, the first capital of ancient Sri Lanka, stands as a testament to the island's rich Buddhist heritage and architectural prowess. This UNESCO World Heritage Site spans over 40 square kilometers and contains some of the most significant Buddhist monuments in the world. The city served as the capital for over 1,300 years, from the 4th century BC to the 11th century AD, making it one of the longest-serving capitals in history.

historicalPoints.4thCenturyBC: 4th Century BC: Anuradhapura was established as the capital by King Pandukabhaya, marking the beginning of a golden age of Sinhalese civilization.
historicalPoints.3rdCenturyBC: 3rd Century BC: King Devanampiya Tissa introduced Buddhism to Sri Lanka, transforming Anuradhapura into a major Buddhist center.
historicalPoints.kingTissaFirstStupa: King Tissa built the first stupa (Thuparamaya), establishing a tradition of monumental Buddhist architecture that would continue for centuries.
historicalPoints.sacredBoSapling: Sacred Bo Tree: The Sri Maha Bodhi, a sapling from the original Bodhi tree under which Buddha attained enlightenment, was planted in 288 BC and still stands today as the oldest historically authenticated tree in the world.
historicalPoints.kingTissaIrrigation: King Tissa initiated large-scale irrigation projects, creating a sophisticated system of tanks and canals that supported the city's agricultural prosperity.
historicalPoints.end3rdCenturyBC: End of 3rd Century BC: The city began to flourish as a center of Buddhist learning, attracting scholars and pilgrims from across Asia.
historicalPoints.2ndCenturyBC: 2nd Century BC: King Dutugemunu expanded the city and built some of its most magnificent structures, including the Ruwanwelisaya stupa.
historicalPoints.kingDutugemunuConstruction: King Dutugemunu's construction projects included massive dagobas, monasteries, and palaces that showcased the architectural and engineering skills of ancient Sinhalese civilization.

jetavanaramaDagoba.title: Jetavanarama Dagoba
jetavanaramaDagoba.description: One of the tallest ancient structures in the world, this massive brick stupa stands at 122 meters and was built in the 3rd century AD by King Mahasena.

isurumuniyaVihara.title: Isurumuniya Vihara
isurumuniyaVihara.description: A rock temple famous for its beautiful carvings, including the famous 'Lovers' sculpture, dating back to the 3rd century BC.

thuparamaDagoba.title: Thuparama Dagoba
thuparamaDagoba.description: The oldest stupa in Sri Lanka, built in the 3rd century BC to enshrine the collarbone relic of the Buddha.

kuttamPokuna.title: Kuttam Pokuna (Twin Ponds)
kuttamPokuna.description: Ancient bathing pools that demonstrate the sophisticated hydraulic engineering of ancient Sinhalese civilization, featuring advanced water filtration systems.

mirisavatiyaDagoba.title: Mirisavatiya Dagoba
mirisavatiyaDagoba.description: Built by King Dutugemunu in the 2nd century BC, this stupa marks the beginning of his great construction projects.

ruwanwalisayaDagoba.title: Ruwanwelisaya Dagoba
ruwanwalisayaDagoba.description: A magnificent white stupa built by King Dutugemunu, considered one of the most sacred Buddhist sites in Sri Lanka.

abhayagiriDagoba.title: Abhayagiri Dagoba
abhayagiriDagoba.description: Once one of the largest monastic complexes in the world, this stupa was a center of learning that attracted scholars from across Asia.

sriMahaBodhi.title: Sri Maha Bodhi
sriMahaBodhi.description: The sacred Bo tree, a sapling from the original Bodhi tree in India, planted in 288 BC and still thriving today as the oldest historically authenticated tree in the world.

belihuloyaDayTour.title: Belihuloya Day Tour
belihuloyaDayTour.description: Discover the scenic beauty of Belihuloya, a charming hill station surrounded by tea plantations, waterfalls, and lush green landscapes.
belihuloyaDayTour.introDescription: Discover the scenic beauty of Belihuloya, a charming hill station surrounded by tea plantations, waterfalls, and lush green landscapes.

detailedDescription.intro: Belihuloya is a picturesque hill station located in the central highlands of Sri Lanka, offering visitors a perfect blend of natural beauty, adventure, and tranquility. Nestled between the hill stations of Nuwara Eliya and Haputale, Belihuloya provides a unique opportunity to experience the cool climate and stunning landscapes of Sri Lanka's hill country.

historicalPoints.scenicBeauty: Scenic Beauty: Surrounded by rolling hills, tea plantations, and misty mountains, Belihuloya offers breathtaking panoramic views at every turn.
historicalPoints.hillStation: Hill Station: Located at an elevation of approximately 1,500 meters above sea level, the area enjoys a cool, pleasant climate year-round.
historicalPoints.climate: Climate: The temperate climate makes it an ideal escape from the tropical heat, with temperatures ranging from 15¬∞C to 25¬∞C throughout the year.
historicalPoints.biodiversity: Biodiversity: The region is rich in flora and fauna, with numerous endemic species of birds, butterflies, and plants thriving in the montane forests.
historicalPoints.adventureActivities: Adventure Activities: The area offers opportunities for hiking, trekking, bird watching, and exploring nearby waterfalls and natural pools.
historicalPoints.culturalHeritage: Cultural Heritage: Experience the local tea culture, visit tea factories, and interact with the friendly local communities.
historicalPoints.naturalWonders: Natural Wonders: Discover hidden waterfalls, pristine streams, and lush forests that make Belihuloya a nature lover's paradise.
historicalPoints.touristDestination: Tourist Destination: While less crowded than other hill stations, Belihuloya is gaining recognition as an off-the-beaten-path destination for travelers seeking authentic experiences.

colomboDayTour.title: Day Tour of Colombo
colomboDayTour.description: Discover the vibrant capital city of Sri Lanka, where colonial architecture meets modern skyscrapers and bustling markets.
colomboDayTour.introDescription: Discover the vibrant capital city of Sri Lanka, where colonial architecture meets modern skyscrapers and bustling markets.

detailedDescription.intro: Colombo, the commercial capital of Sri Lanka, is a vibrant city that beautifully blends its colonial past with modern development. This ancient heritage reflects on the city today in terms of its architecture consisting of colonial buildings as well as high rise skyscrapers and shopping malls.

historicalPoints.colonialHeritage: Colonial Heritage: Colombo features well-preserved colonial architecture from Portuguese, Dutch, and British periods.
historicalPoints.commercialCapital: Commercial Capital: As Sri Lanka's largest city and commercial hub, Colombo is the gateway to the island.
historicalPoints.culturalDiversity: Cultural Diversity: Experience a rich blend of Sinhalese, Tamil, Muslim, and Burgher cultures.
historicalPoints.modernDevelopment: Modern Development: Witness the city's transformation with modern skyscrapers, shopping malls, and luxury hotels.
historicalPoints.religiousSites: Religious Sites: Visit Buddhist temples, Hindu kovils, mosques, and churches showcasing religious harmony.
historicalPoints.marketsShopping: Markets & Shopping: Explore vibrant markets like Pettah and modern shopping complexes.
historicalPoints.culinaryScene: Culinary Scene: Savor diverse cuisine from street food to fine dining restaurants.
historicalPoints.coastalBeauty: Coastal Beauty: Enjoy the scenic Galle Face Green promenade along the Indian Ocean.

gangaramayaTemple.title: Gangaramaya Temple
gangaramayaTemple.description: A blend of modern architecture and cultural heritage, Gangaramaya Temple is a peaceful Buddhist temple showcasing sacred relics, statues, and a serene meditation environment.

stLuciasCathedral.title: St. Lucia's Cathedral
stLuciasCathedral.description: This magnificent Catholic cathedral features neo-baroque architecture, beautiful stained-glass windows, and serves as a spiritual landmark for worshippers in the heart of Colombo.

redMosque.title: Red Mosque (Jami Ul-Alfar Mosque)
redMosque.description: Famous for its striking red-and-white patterned exterior, the Red Mosque is a historical Islamic site and an iconic architectural symbol in Colombo.

nationalMuseum.title: National Museum
nationalMuseum.description: The Colombo National Museum houses Sri Lanka's rich history, art, and culture, featuring royal artifacts, ancient weapons, and archaeological treasures.

kathiresanKovil.title: Kathiresan Kovil
kathiresanKovil.description: A vibrant Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Murugan, Kathiresan Kovil is known for its colorful architecture, detailed sculptures, and lively religious festivals.

cargillsBuilding.title: Cargills Building
cargillsBuilding.description: A historic commercial building in Colombo, the Cargills Building represents the city's colonial-era architecture and continues to be a hub for shopping and business.

lotusTower.title: Lotus Tower
lotusTower.description: Standing as Sri Lanka's tallest structure, Lotus Tower offers panoramic city views, a revolving restaurant, and entertainment facilities, symbolizing modern Colombo and its architectural marvels.

galleDayTour.title: Galle Day Tour
galleDayTour.description: Immerse yourself in the charm of Sri Lanka's southern coast as you walk the storied ramparts of Galle Fort, visit heritage landmarks, and unwind on sun-kissed beaches.
galleDayTour.introDescription: Immerse yourself in the charm of Sri Lanka's southern coast as you walk the storied ramparts of Galle Fort, visit heritage landmarks, and unwind on sun-kissed beaches.

detailedDescription.intro: Galle's legacy as a maritime hub blends European fortifications with Sri Lankan spirit. Spend the day exploring cobbled alleys, lofty bastions, artisan boutiques, and the coastal escapes that make the southern capital unforgettable.

historicalPoints.unescoHeritage: UNESCO Heritage: Traverse the Galle Fort ramparts, watchtowers, and colonial mansions that earned the city its World Heritage status.
historicalPoints.colonialArchitecture: Colonial Architecture: Spot Dutch-era churches, British administrative buildings, and pastel merchant houses lining the streets.
historicalPoints.culturalBlend: Cultural Blend: Experience a harmonious mix of Sinhalese, Moor, Burgher, and expatriate communities shaping the city's flavors and festivals.
historicalPoints.artisanBoutiques: Artisan Boutiques: Browse handloom textiles, gem studios, handicraft shops, and chic cafes tucked into heritage buildings.
historicalPoints.seasideViews: Seaside Views: Take in sweeping ocean panoramas from the lighthouse, sun-drenched beaches, and palm-fringed promenades.
historicalPoints.culinaryFinds: Culinary Finds: Savor fresh seafood, fusion fare, and tropical treats at fort restaurants and seaside shacks.
historicalPoints.adventureStops: Adventure Stops: Add optional activities like cycling, snorkeling, or boat rides through nearby mangroves for an active twist.
historicalPoints.relaxationBreaks: Relaxation Breaks: Unwind with sunset picnics on the ramparts or spa treatments at boutique hotels tucked inside the fort.

galleFort.title: Galle Fort
galleFort.description: Galle Fort is a UNESCO heritage site with colonial architecture, museums, charming streets, ocean views, cafes, and cultural landmarks, offering a unique blend of history.

galleLighthouse.title: Galle Lighthouse
galleLighthouse.description: Galle Lighthouse is an iconic coastal landmark offering ocean views, beautiful sunsets, refreshing sea breeze, and great photography opportunities, making it one of Galle's highlights.

dutchReformedChurch.title: Dutch Reformed Church
dutchReformedChurch.description: The Dutch Reformed Church, built in the 18th century, features colonial architecture, historic gravestones, and a peaceful interior, offering visitors a glimpse into Galle's past.

maritimeMuseum.title: Maritime Museum
maritimeMuseum.description: The Maritime Museum highlights Galle's seafaring history through shipwreck exhibits, ancient trade artifacts, and underwater discoveries, offering visitors an educational experience.

jungleBeach.title: Jungle Beach
jungleBeach.description: Jungle Beach is a hidden coastal escape with calm waters, soft sand, lush surroundings, and great snorkeling, offering visitors a peaceful place to relax.

japanesePeacePagoda.title: Japanese Peace Pagoda
japanesePeacePagoda.description: The Japanese Peace Pagoda sits on a quiet hilltop offering panoramic coastal views, peaceful surroundings, and a calming spiritual atmosphere, making it a beautiful spot.

unawatunaBeach.title: Unawatuna Beach
unawatunaBeach.description: Unawatuna Beach is a lively coastal destination with golden sand, clear water, beachside restaurants, swimming spots, and nightlife, offering visitors a fun and relaxing experience.

stiltFishermen.title: Stilt Fishermen (Koggala)
stiltFishermen.description: Stilt fishermen in Koggala display traditional fishing methods beside scenic shores, offering visitors cultural insight, photo opportunities, and an authentic Sri Lankan experience.

geoffreyBawaWorksSriLanka.title: Geoffrey Bawa Works in Sri Lanka
geoffreyBawaWorksSriLanka.description: When the late Geoffrey Manning Bawa entered the world of architecture, he made his mark with every design he produced. Exploring modernism and its cultural implications‚Ä¶
geoffreyBawaWorksSriLanka.introDescription: When the late Geoffrey Manning Bawa entered the world of architecture, he made his mark with every design he produced. Exploring modernism and its cultural implications‚Ä¶

detailedDescription.intro: When the late Geoffrey Manning Bawa entered the world of architecture, he made his mark with every design he produced. Exploring modernism and its cultural implications, Bawa created a unique architectural language that seamlessly blended tropical landscapes with contemporary design principles. His works across Sri Lanka stand as testaments to his vision of architecture that respects nature, celebrates local materials, and creates spaces that breathe with their environment.
detailedDescription.architecturalLegacyTitle: The Architectural Legacy of Geoffrey Bawa

architecturalPoints.tropicalModernism: Tropical Modernism: Bawa pioneered a style that combined modernist principles with tropical sensibilities, creating buildings that respond to climate, landscape, and culture.
architecturalPoints.integrationWithNature: Integration with Nature: His designs blur the boundaries between indoor and outdoor spaces, using courtyards, verandas, and open pavilions to connect architecture with the natural world.
architecturalPoints.localMaterials: Local Materials: Bawa championed the use of local materials and traditional building techniques, adapting them to modern needs while preserving cultural authenticity.
architecturalPoints.landscapeArchitecture: Landscape Architecture: Beyond buildings, Bawa was a master landscape architect, creating gardens and outdoor spaces that are works of art in themselves.
architecturalPoints.internationalRecognition: International Recognition: His work has influenced architects worldwide and established Sri Lanka as a significant center of tropical architecture.
architecturalPoints.adaptiveReuse: Adaptive Reuse: Bawa excelled at transforming historic buildings, respecting their heritage while adapting them for contemporary use.
architecturalPoints.sustainableDesign: Sustainable Design: Long before sustainability became a buzzword, Bawa's designs demonstrated environmental sensitivity through passive cooling, natural ventilation, and minimal environmental impact.
architecturalPoints.culturalContext: Cultural Context: Each of Bawa's projects reflects a deep understanding of Sri Lankan culture, history, and way of life, creating architecture that is both modern and deeply rooted in place.

lunuganga.title: Lunuganga Garden
lunuganga.description: Lunuganga is Geoffrey Bawa's country estate and garden, a masterpiece of tropical landscape design that showcases his vision of blending architecture with nature.

numberEleven.title: Number Eleven
numberEleven.description: Number Eleven is Bawa's Colombo residence, now a museum showcasing his personal collection and design philosophy.

parliament.title: Parliament Building
parliament.description: The Sri Lankan Parliament Building in Kotte is one of Bawa's most significant public works, reflecting his mastery of monumental architecture.

paradiseRoadGallery.title: Paradise Road Gallery Caf√©
paradiseRoadGallery.description: A vibrant conversion of Bawa's former office garage, now a celebrated caf√© blending his architectural aesthetic with contemporary art and design.

ratnasivaratnamHouse.title: The Ratnasivaratnam House
ratnasivaratnamHouse.description: A pioneering courtyard house in Colombo, celebrated for its ingenious use of a narrow urban plot to create a light-filled, private family home.

steelCorporation.title: Steel Corporation Offices and Housing
steelCorporation.description: A robust industrial complex where modern forms are softened by landscaped courtyards and passive cooling techniques, creating a humane working environment.

hotAirBallooningDayTour.title: Hot Air Ballooning Day Tour
hotAirBallooningDayTour.description: Enjoy an experience of a lifetime as you feel the adrenaline rush while drifting off over breathtaking views of the tropical paradise of Sri Lanka.
hotAirBallooningDayTour.introDescription: Enjoy an experience of a lifetime as you feel the adrenaline rush while drifting off over breathtaking views of the tropical paradise of Sri Lanka.

detailedDescription.intro: Experience the magic of floating above Sri Lanka's stunning landscapes in a hot air balloon. This unforgettable adventure offers panoramic views of ancient ruins, lush forests, and picturesque countryside as you gently drift through the morning sky.

kandyDayTour.title: Kandy Day Tour
kandyDayTour.description: Kandy, more popularly known as the hill capital of Sri Lanka, is an attractive tourist destination. Its history dates back to the 15th century‚Ä¶
kandyDayTour.introDescription: Kandy, more popularly known as the hill capital of Sri Lanka, is an attractive tourist destination. Its history dates back to the 15th century when it was established as the last capital of the ancient kings era of Sri Lanka. The city is nestled in the hills of the Kandy plateau, which crosses areas of tropical plantations, mainly tea. Kandy is both an administrative and religious city and is also the capital of the Central Province.

detailedDescription.intro: Kandy, more popularly known as the hill capital of Sri Lanka, is an attractive tourist destination. Its history dates back to the 15th century when it was established as the last capital of the ancient kings era of Sri Lanka. The city is nestled in the hills of the Kandy plateau, which crosses areas of tropical plantations, mainly tea. Kandy is both an administrative and religious city and is also the capital of the Central Province.

historicalPoints.15thCentury: 15th Century: Kandy was established as the last capital of the ancient kings era of Sri Lanka.
historicalPoints.templeOfTheTooth: Temple of the Tooth Relic: The sacred Temple of the Tooth Relic (Sri Dalada Maligawa) houses the tooth relic of the Buddha, making it one of the most important Buddhist sites in the world.
historicalPoints.unescoHeritage: UNESCO World Heritage Site: Kandy was declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1988, recognizing its cultural and historical significance.
historicalPoints.kandyanKingdom: Kandyan Kingdom: The city served as the capital of the Kandyan Kingdom, which successfully resisted European colonial powers for over 300 years.
historicalPoints.britishColonial: British Colonial Period: Kandy fell to the British in 1815, ending the independent Kandyan Kingdom.
historicalPoints.culturalCenter: Cultural Center: Today, Kandy remains a major cultural center, known for its traditional arts, crafts, and the annual Esala Perahera festival.

templeOfTheTooth.title: Temple of the Tooth Relic
templeOfTheTooth.description: The most sacred Buddhist temple in Sri Lanka, housing the tooth relic of the Buddha and a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

kandyLake.title: Kandy Lake
kandyLake.description: A beautiful artificial lake built in 1807 by the last king of Kandy, offering scenic views and a peaceful atmosphere in the heart of the city.

royalBotanicalGardens.title: Royal Botanical Gardens
royalBotanicalGardens.description: One of the finest tropical gardens in Asia, featuring over 4,000 species of plants, including rare orchids, palms, and medicinal plants.

kandyViewPoint.title: Kandy View Point
kandyViewPoint.description: A panoramic viewpoint offering stunning vistas of Kandy city, the lake, and surrounding hills.

kandyMarket.title: Kandy Market
kandyMarket.description: A vibrant local market where you can experience the daily life of Kandy, shop for spices, fruits, and local handicrafts.

bahirawakandaBuddha.title: Bahirawakanda Buddha Statue
bahirawakandaBuddha.description: A massive white Buddha statue perched on a hilltop, offering panoramic views of Kandy and the surrounding mountains.

kandyMuseum.title: Kandy Museum
kandyMuseum.description: Housed in the former royal palace, the museum displays artifacts from the Kandyan Kingdom era, including royal regalia and historical items.

udawattekeleSanctuary.title: Udawatta Kele Sanctuary
udawattekeleSanctuary.description: A forest reserve in the heart of Kandy, home to diverse bird species, monkeys, and lush vegetation, perfect for nature walks.

kithulgalaWhiteWaterRafting.title: Kithulgala White Water Rafting
kithulgalaWhiteWaterRafting.description: The town of Kitulgala is where this tour will take you for a day filled with extreme adventure. Kitulgala is a small, yet beautiful town located in a wet zone rain forest‚Ä¶
kithulgalaWhiteWaterRafting.introDescription: The town of Kitulgala is where this tour will take you for a day filled with extreme adventure. Kitulgala is a small, yet beautiful town located in a wet zone rain forest. This picturesque destination is famous for being the filming location of the classic movie "The Bridge on the River Kwai" and offers one of the best white water rafting experiences in Sri Lanka.

detailedDescription.intro: The town of Kitulgala is where this tour will take you for a day filled with extreme adventure. Kitulgala is a small, yet beautiful town located in a wet zone rain forest. This picturesque destination is famous for being the filming location of the classic movie "The Bridge on the River Kwai" and offers one of the best white water rafting experiences in Sri Lanka.

adventurePoints.raftingExperience: White Water Rafting: Experience the thrill of navigating through rapids on the Kelani River, one of Sri Lanka's most exciting rafting destinations with rapids ranging from Grade 2 to Grade 3.
adventurePoints.scenicBeauty: Scenic Beauty: Surrounded by lush rainforest, cascading waterfalls, and pristine natural landscapes, Kitulgala offers breathtaking views throughout your adventure.
adventurePoints.safetyStandards: Safety Standards: All rafting activities are conducted with professional guides, safety equipment, and international safety standards to ensure a safe yet thrilling experience.
adventurePoints.suitableForAll: Suitable for All Levels: Whether you're a beginner or an experienced rafter, the rapids are suitable for various skill levels, making it accessible to adventure enthusiasts of all ages.
adventurePoints.otherActivities: Additional Activities: Beyond rafting, Kitulgala offers opportunities for jungle trekking, bird watching, and exploring the rich biodiversity of the rainforest.
adventurePoints.filmLocation: Film Location: Visit the iconic bridge location where the Academy Award-winning film "The Bridge on the River Kwai" was filmed, adding historical significance to your adventure.

littleEnglandDayTour.title: Little England Day Tour
littleEnglandDayTour.description: Nuwara Eliya, also known as Sri Lanka's "Little England", is the prime hill resort of the country. At a height of approximately 2000m above sea level‚Ä¶
littleEnglandDayTour.introDescription: Nuwara Eliya, also known as Sri Lanka's "Little England", is the prime hill resort of the country. At a height of approximately 2000m above sea level, this charming town offers a cool climate, lush tea plantations, and a distinctly British colonial atmosphere. The town is famous for its beautiful gardens, colonial architecture, and scenic landscapes that resemble the English countryside.

detailedDescription.intro: Nuwara Eliya, also known as Sri Lanka's "Little England", is the prime hill resort of the country. At a height of approximately 2000m above sea level, this charming town offers a cool climate, lush tea plantations, and a distinctly British colonial atmosphere. The town is famous for its beautiful gardens, colonial architecture, and scenic landscapes that resemble the English countryside.

historicalPoints.britishColonial: British Colonial Era: Nuwara Eliya was developed by the British in the 19th century as a hill station to escape the heat of the lowlands, creating a "Little England" atmosphere.
historicalPoints.teaIndustry: Tea Industry: The region became the heart of Sri Lanka's tea industry, with many tea plantations established by British planters, making it one of the world's finest tea-growing regions.
historicalPoints.colonialArchitecture: Colonial Architecture: The town features well-preserved colonial buildings, including the Grand Hotel, St. Andrew's Hotel, and various bungalows that reflect British architectural styles.
historicalPoints.golfCourse: Golf Course: Nuwara Eliya is home to one of Asia's oldest golf courses, established in 1889, adding to its British colonial charm.
historicalPoints.climate: Cool Climate: The high altitude provides a temperate climate year-round, making it a perfect retreat from the tropical heat of the coastal areas.
historicalPoints.touristDestination: Tourist Destination: Today, Nuwara Eliya is one of Sri Lanka's most popular tourist destinations, known for its natural beauty, tea estates, and unique colonial heritage.

gregoryLake.title: Gregory Lake
gregoryLake.description: A beautiful man-made lake offering boating, horse riding, and scenic views of the surrounding mountains and tea plantations.

hakgalaBotanicalGardens.title: Hakgala Botanical Gardens
hakgalaBotanicalGardens.description: One of the three botanical gardens in Sri Lanka, featuring a stunning collection of roses, ferns, and exotic plants in a cool mountain setting.

seethaAmmamTemple.title: Seetha Amman Temple
seethaAmmamTemple.description: A Hindu temple associated with the Ramayana epic, located in a beautiful setting with a stream and natural rock formations.

victoriaPark.title: Victoria Park
victoriaPark.description: A well-maintained park in the heart of Nuwara Eliya, perfect for leisurely walks and enjoying the cool mountain air.

teaPlantations.title: Tea Plantations
teaPlantations.description: Visit working tea estates to learn about the tea-making process and enjoy fresh Ceylon tea while surrounded by rolling green hills.

loversLeap.title: Lovers' Leap
loversLeap.description: A scenic waterfall with a romantic legend, offering beautiful views and a refreshing natural setting.

pedroTeaEstate.title: Pedro Tea Estate
pedroTeaEstate.description: One of the oldest and most famous tea estates in Nuwara Eliya, offering factory tours and tea tasting experiences.

moonPlains.title: Moon Plains
moonPlains.description: A unique high-altitude plain offering panoramic views of the surrounding mountains and valleys, accessible by jeep safari.

negomboLagoonFishingDayTour.title: Negombo Lagoon Fishing Day Tour
negomboLagoonFishingDayTour.description: Along the West Coast of Sri Lanka is the friendly city of Negombo, one of the oldest fishing towns in the country. In addition to its centuries-old fishing industry‚Ä¶
negomboLagoonFishingDayTour.introDescription: Along the West Coast of Sri Lanka is the friendly city of Negombo, one of the oldest fishing towns in the country. In addition to its centuries-old fishing industry, Negombo is also known for its beautiful beaches, Dutch colonial architecture, and the famous Negombo Lagoon. This tour offers a unique opportunity to experience traditional fishing methods and explore the rich maritime culture of this coastal town.

detailedDescription.intro: Along the West Coast of Sri Lanka is the friendly city of Negombo, one of the oldest fishing towns in the country. In addition to its centuries-old fishing industry, Negombo is also known for its beautiful beaches, Dutch colonial architecture, and the famous Negombo Lagoon. This tour offers a unique opportunity to experience traditional fishing methods and explore the rich maritime culture of this coastal town.

negomboLagoon.title: Negombo Lagoon
negomboLagoon.description: Learn traditional and modern ways of fishing. Here you will see live cooking of the seafood you picked for lunch.

negomboBeach.title: Negombo Beach
negomboBeach.description: Relax on the beautiful golden sands of Negombo Beach, one of the most popular beaches on the west coast. Enjoy the calm waters, perfect for swimming, and take in the stunning sunset views over the Indian Ocean.

polonnaruwaDayTour.title: Polonnaruwa Day Tour
polonnaruwaDayTour.description: Being the second-largest kingdom in Sri Lanka, the ancient city of Polonnaruwa has much in store for archaeologists, history lovers‚Ä¶
polonnaruwaDayTour.introDescription: Being the second-largest kingdom in Sri Lanka, the ancient city of Polonnaruwa has much in store for archaeologists, history lovers, and travelers seeking to explore the rich cultural heritage of the island. Polonnaruwa served as the capital of Sri Lanka from the 11th to 13th centuries AD and is now a UNESCO World Heritage Site, showcasing well-preserved ruins of ancient palaces, temples, and monuments.

detailedDescription.intro: Being the second-largest kingdom in Sri Lanka, the ancient city of Polonnaruwa has much in store for archaeologists, history lovers, and travelers seeking to explore the rich cultural heritage of the island. Polonnaruwa served as the capital of Sri Lanka from the 11th to 13th centuries AD and is now a UNESCO World Heritage Site, showcasing well-preserved ruins of ancient palaces, temples, and monuments.

historicalPoints.11thCentury: 11th Century AD: Polonnaruwa became the capital of Sri Lanka after the fall of Anuradhapura, marking the beginning of a new era in Sri Lankan history.
historicalPoints.kingVijayabahu: King Vijayabahu I: Successfully drove out the Chola invaders and established Polonnaruwa as the new capital, beginning a period of great architectural and cultural development.
historicalPoints.kingParakramabahu: King Parakramabahu I: The golden age of Polonnaruwa, known for extensive irrigation works, including the massive Parakrama Samudra (sea of Parakrama), and magnificent architectural achievements.
historicalPoints.unescoHeritage: UNESCO World Heritage Site: Polonnaruwa was declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1982, recognizing its outstanding universal value and well-preserved archaeological remains.
historicalPoints.architecturalAchievements: Architectural Achievements: The city features remarkable examples of ancient Sinhalese architecture, including the Gal Vihara rock temple with its massive Buddha statues carved from granite.
historicalPoints.irrigationSystem: Irrigation System: Polonnaruwa is famous for its sophisticated irrigation system, with numerous tanks and canals that demonstrate advanced hydraulic engineering of the ancient Sinhalese.
historicalPoints.decline: 13th Century Decline: The kingdom began to decline in the 13th century, eventually leading to the abandonment of Polonnaruwa as the capital and the shift of power to other regions.

quadrangle.title: The Quadrangle
quadrangle.description: A compact group of ancient buildings including the Vatadage, Thuparama, and other significant structures, showcasing the architectural brilliance of ancient Polonnaruwa.

galVihara.title: Gal Vihara
galVihara.description: A rock temple featuring four magnificent Buddha statues carved from a single granite rock, including a massive reclining Buddha, considered masterpieces of ancient Sinhalese sculpture.

rankotVihara.title: Rankot Vihara
rankotVihara.description: The largest dagoba in Polonnaruwa, standing at 55 meters tall, built during the reign of King Nissanka Malla in the 12th century.

parakramaSamudra.title: Parakrama Samudra
parakramaSamudra.description: A massive man-made reservoir built by King Parakramabahu I, covering an area of 2,500 hectares and demonstrating the advanced irrigation engineering of ancient Sri Lanka.

potgulVihara.title: Potgul Vihara
potgulVihara.description: A unique library complex with a circular structure, believed to have housed ancient manuscripts and religious texts.

sigiriyaDambullaDayTour.title: Sigiriya & Dambulla Day Tour
sigiriyaDambullaDayTour.description: Sigiriya, an ancient palace, was once nominated as the 8th wonder of the world. Today, Sigiriya and Dambulla are a UNESCO recognized heritage site and a major tourist attraction.
sigiriyaDambullaDayTour.introDescription: Sigiriya, an ancient palace, was once nominated as the 8th wonder of the world. Today, Sigiriya and Dambulla are a UNESCO recognized heritage site and a major tourist attraction.

detailedDescription.intro: Sigiriya, an ancient palace and rock fortress, was once nominated as the 8th wonder of the world. Today, Sigiriya and Dambulla are UNESCO recognized heritage sites and major tourist attractions. This day tour takes you through two of Sri Lanka's most iconic historical sites, showcasing ancient architecture, stunning frescoes, and remarkable cave temples that tell the story of a rich cultural heritage spanning over two millennia.

historicalPoints.5thCenturyAD: 5th Century AD: King Kassapa I built the palace fortress on top of Sigiriya Rock, creating one of the most remarkable architectural achievements of ancient Sri Lanka.
historicalPoints.sigiriyaFrescoes: Sigiriya Frescoes: The famous paintings of celestial maidens (apsaras) are considered masterpieces of ancient Sri Lankan art, dating back over 1,500 years.
historicalPoints.dambullaCaves: 1st Century BC: Dambulla Cave Temple was established by King Valagamba, who took refuge in the caves during an invasion. The temple complex has been continuously used for over 2,000 years.
historicalPoints.unescoHeritage: UNESCO World Heritage Sites: Both Sigiriya (1982) and Dambulla (1991) were declared UNESCO World Heritage Sites, recognizing their outstanding universal value and cultural significance.
historicalPoints.architecturalMarvels: Architectural Marvels: Sigiriya features sophisticated water gardens, mirror walls, and the iconic Lion Gate, while Dambulla houses over 150 Buddha statues and extensive cave paintings.
historicalPoints.culturalTriangle: Cultural Triangle: Both sites are part of Sri Lanka's Cultural Triangle, along with Anuradhapura and Polonnaruwa, representing the golden age of ancient Sinhalese civilization.
historicalPoints.kingParakramabahu: 12th Century AD: King Parakramabahu I renovated and expanded the Dambulla Cave Temple, adding many of the statues and paintings that can be seen today.
historicalPoints.modernSignificance: Modern Significance: Today, these sites attract millions of visitors annually and remain active places of worship, requiring respect and proper attire from visitors.

sigiriyaRock.title: Sigiriya Rock Fortress
sigiriyaRock.description: An ancient rock fortress and palace ruins located in the Matale District. Sigiriya is a UNESCO World Heritage Site, famous for its ancient frescoes and the mirror wall.

dambullaCaveTemple.title: Dambulla Cave Temple
dambullaCaveTemple.description: Also known as the Golden Temple of Dambulla, this is the largest and best-preserved cave temple complex in Sri Lanka, featuring over 150 Buddha statues.

sigiriyaFrescoes.title: Sigiriya Frescoes
sigiriyaFrescoes.description: The famous ancient paintings of Sigiriya, depicting celestial maidens, are considered masterpieces of ancient Sri Lankan art.

mirrorWall.title: Mirror Wall
mirrorWall.description: A polished plaster wall that once reflected like a mirror, now covered with ancient graffiti and poems dating back over 1,000 years.

lionGate.title: Lion Gate
lionGate.description: The massive stone paws of a lion that once guarded the entrance to the palace at the summit of Sigiriya Rock.

waterGardens.title: Water Gardens
waterGardens.description: Sophisticated hydraulic systems and symmetrical water gardens at the base of Sigiriya Rock, showcasing ancient engineering marvels.

sinharajaDayTour.title: Sinharaja Day Tour
sinharajaDayTour.description: UNESCO World Heritage site since 1988. Currently, the reserve spans 8864 hectares and the country plans to quadruple the size of the area to respect the ecological significance of the region.
sinharajaDayTour.introDescription: UNESCO World Heritage site since 1988. Currently, the reserve spans 8864 hectares and the country plans to quadruple the size of the area to respect the ecological significance of the region.

detailedDescription.intro: The rich and unique animal and plant life in the Sinharaja Rainforest Reserve is the reason why it was marked as a UNESCO World Heritage site in 1988. Currently, the reserve spans 8864 hectares and the country plans to quadruple the size of the area to respect the ecological significance of the region. The hilly virgin rainforest is a treasure trove of endemic species including mammals, reptiles, birds, amphibians and of course, an abundance of trees and insects. Particularly known for bird watching, an interesting phenomenon here is that birds move in mixed feeding flocks, led by the great Racket-tailed Drongo and the noisy Orange-billed Babbler. 20 of the 26 endemic bird species in Sri Lanka are seen at the Sinharaja Rainforest. In addition to bids, more than 60% of the plants are endemic, many of which are rare. The reserve is also home to more than 50% of the country's endemic mammal, butterfly, reptile, amphibian and insect species.
detailedDescription.journeyTitle: Journey into the Wild Heart of Sinharaja

journeyPoints.trek: Trek through the Sinharaja Rainforest, a UNESCO World Heritage Site and Sri Lanka's last significant stretch of primary tropical rainforest.
journeyPoints.biodiversity: Discover an incredible biodiversity hotspot where a majority of Sri Lanka's endemic species of mammals and insects thrive.
journeyPoints.junglefowl: Keep your eyes on the canopy to spot rare endemic birds like the vibrant red-faced Sri Lanka Junglefowl.
journeyPoints.owl: Listen for the distinctive call of the Serendib Scops-Owl, one of the many rare birds found only here.
journeyPoints.guide: Your expert naturalist guide will help you locate elusive wildlife and explain the forest's complex, delicate ecosystem.
journeyPoints.canopy: Marvel at the lush emerald-green canopy filled with a vast variety of native trees and medicinal plants.
journeyPoints.reptiles: Witness a stunning array of unique reptiles and amphibians that call this protected rainforest their home.
journeyPoints.atmosphere: Experience the tranquil atmosphere and cool, moist air under the dense shade of the interlocking forest canopy.
journeyPoints.paths: Follow winding paths past gentle streams and small, picturesque waterfalls hidden deep within the virgin woodland.
journeyPoints.beauty: Be captivated by the sheer beauty of this untouched wilderness, a true paradise for nature lovers and photographers.
journeyPoints.immersive: This guided tour offers an immersive and educational journey into the heart of a living, breathing ecosystem.
journeyPoints.magpie: Encounter the unforgettable sight of the brilliant Sri Lanka Blue Magpie, a flagship species of Sinharaja.

birds.title: Birds
birds.description: The Sinharaja Rain Forest in Sri Lanka is renowned for its unique and diverse bird species, many of which are endemic to the island, making it a haven for birdwatchers and conservationists. Below are some of the birds you will witness: Sri Lankan Blue Magpie, Grey Hornbill, Red Faced Malkoha, Scaly Thrush, Wood Pigeon, Yellow Eared Bulbul, Dusky Blue Flycatcher.

mammals.title: Mammals
mammals.description: The Sinharaja Rain Forest boasts a rich tapestry of mammalian life, with many species that are exclusively found in Sri Lanka, offering a captivating experience for wildlife enthusiasts.

reptiles.title: Reptiles
reptiles.description: The Sinharaja Rain Forest is a treasure trove of reptilian diversity, harboring a range of species that have made this Sri Lankan gem their exclusive home.

rainforestReserve.title: Sinharaja Rainforest Reserve
rainforestReserve.description: Due to the dense vegetation, animal spotting is a challenge. This kind of atmosphere is a real treat to wildlife enthusiasts though who are eagerly waiting to travel deep into the forests in search of rare wildlife.

udawalaweNationalParkDayTour.title: Udawalawe National Park Day Tour
udawalaweNationalParkDayTour.description: This park is the third most visited park in all of Sri Lanka and presents visitors with a fusion of flora and fauna. Herds of elephants, buffalos, deer‚Ä¶
udawalaweNationalParkDayTour.introDescription: This park is the third most visited park in all of Sri Lanka and presents visitors with a fusion of flora and fauna. Herds of elephants, buffalos, deer, and diverse bird species make this a wildlife enthusiast's paradise.

detailedDescription.intro: Udawalawe National Park is the third most visited park in all of Sri Lanka and presents visitors with a fusion of flora and fauna. The park is renowned for its large herds of elephants, buffalos, deer, and diverse bird species. This day tour offers an unforgettable wildlife safari experience in one of Sri Lanka's most accessible and wildlife-rich national parks.

highlights.elephants: Elephant Herds: Udawalawe is famous for its large elephant populations, offering excellent opportunities to observe these majestic creatures in their natural habitat.
highlights.wildlife: Diverse Wildlife: Spot water buffalos, spotted deer, sambar deer, wild boar, and various other mammals throughout the park.
highlights.birds: Bird Watching: The park is home to over 180 bird species, including endemic and migratory birds, making it a paradise for bird enthusiasts.
highlights.reservoir: Udawalawe Reservoir: The park surrounds the Udawalawe Reservoir, creating a unique ecosystem that attracts diverse wildlife.
highlights.safari: Jeep Safari Experience: Enjoy a thrilling jeep safari through the park's varied terrain, from grasslands to scrub forests.
highlights.accessibility: Easy Accessibility: Located just 180 km from Colombo, Udawalawe is easily accessible and perfect for a day trip.
highlights.conservation: Conservation Success: The park plays a crucial role in elephant conservation and is home to the Udawalawe Elephant Transit Home.

elephantSafari.title: Elephant Safari
elephantSafari.description: Experience close encounters with wild elephants in their natural habitat at Udawalawe National Park. Witness these majestic creatures as they roam freely, bathe in waterholes, and interact with their herds.

wildlifeSpotting.title: Wildlife Spotting
wildlifeSpotting.description: Spot diverse wildlife including elephants, water buffalos, spotted deer, sambar deer, wild boar, and over 180 bird species. The park offers excellent opportunities for wildlife photography and bird watching.

whaleWatchingDayTour.title: Whale Watching Day Tour
whaleWatchingDayTour.description: Sri Lanka is one of the best destinations for whale watching in Asia. Sperm Whales and Blue Whales are a common occurrence off the southern coast‚Ä¶
whaleWatchingDayTour.introDescription: Sri Lanka is one of the best destinations for whale watching in Asia. Sperm Whales and Blue Whales are a common occurrence off the southern coast, particularly around Mirissa. This day tour offers an unforgettable experience to witness these magnificent marine giants in their natural habitat. The best time for whale watching is from November to April, when the ocean conditions are ideal and whale sightings are most frequent.

detailedDescription.intro: Sri Lanka is one of the best destinations for whale watching in Asia. Sperm Whales and Blue Whales are a common occurrence off the southern coast, particularly around Mirissa. This day tour offers an unforgettable experience to witness these magnificent marine giants in their natural habitat. The best time for whale watching is from November to April, when the ocean conditions are ideal and whale sightings are most frequent.

wilpattuNationalParkDayTour.title: Wilpattu National Park Day Tour
wilpattuNationalParkDayTour.description: For your day tour of Wilpattu National Park, you will be taken on a jeep safari around the park to spot Sri Lanka's wild animals such as elephants, jackal, sloth bear, leopard
wilpattuNationalParkDayTour.introDescription: For your day tour of Wilpattu National Park, you will be taken on a jeep safari around the park to spot Sri Lanka's wild animals such as elephants, jackal, sloth bear, and leopard. Wilpattu is the largest and one of the oldest national parks in Sri Lanka, known for its unique 'willus' (natural lakes) and diverse wildlife. The park offers an authentic safari experience with opportunities to see leopards, elephants, and many other species in their natural habitat.

detailedDescription.intro: For your day tour of Wilpattu National Park, you will be taken on a jeep safari around the park to spot Sri Lanka's wild animals such as elephants, jackal, sloth bear, and leopard. Wilpattu is the largest and one of the oldest national parks in Sri Lanka, known for its unique 'willus' (natural lakes) and diverse wildlife. The park offers an authentic safari experience with opportunities to see leopards, elephants, and many other species in their natural habitat.

yalaNationalParkDayTour.title: Yala National Park Day Tour
yalaNationalParkDayTour.description: Have you ever been on a safari in a jungle that is ruled by the leopards? The Yala National Park is your answer! With 130,000 hectares of landscape‚Ä¶
yalaNationalParkDayTour.introDescription: Have you ever been on a safari in a jungle that is ruled by the leopards? The Yala National Park is your answer! With 130,000 hectares of landscape, Yala is Sri Lanka's most famous national park and has the highest density of leopards in the world. This day tour offers an incredible opportunity to spot leopards, elephants, sloth bears, crocodiles, and a wide variety of bird species in their natural habitat.

detailedDescription.intro: Have you ever been on a safari in a jungle that is ruled by the leopards? The Yala National Park is your answer! With 130,000 hectares of landscape, Yala is Sri Lanka's most famous national park and has the highest density of leopards in the world. This day tour offers an incredible opportunity to spot leopards, elephants, sloth bears, crocodiles, and a wide variety of bird species in their natural habitat.

ourStory.title: About Ceyara Tours
ourStory.intro: Ceyara Tours is the present and future of destination management in Sri Lanka, where the most exciting tropical holidays happen in South Asia.
ourStory.description:
Founded in 2010, we have built an unwavering reputation for possessing an impressive portfolio for travel even for the most discerning traveler. Our insight and in-depth knowledge of Sri Lanka and its most beautiful and most valued destinations have given us the privilege of trust by our wide and growing clientele from around the world, including the 2014 ,2015,2016 and 2017 Certificate of Excellence from TripAdvisor. We bring you intimate and personalized services that are unmatched by most other travel companies, and we make it our responsibility to sponsor a friendly relationship between the clients and suppliers to bring you ultimate satisfaction from your Sri Lankan holiday.

We have over 1000 accommodation properties in our portfolio and they have been chosen for their excellence of service, special significance, artistic and cultural importance and value for your money. These include boutique hotels, beach hotels, bungalows and mansions, cultural area hotels, camping sites and hill country hotels. We make sure every accommodation provider we deal with maintain their good standards and are monitored and overseen by us for quality assurance. A diverse range of tours focused on culture, beaches, adventure and honeymoon give you the opportunity of discovering many hidden wonders and pleasures of the island. We do not promote anything we have not experienced and enjoyed ourselves.
Our holidays are tailor-made to your requirements and our travel advice is personalized and detailed to make sure you receive what you are looking for in the best possible package. Our services along with our commitment to provide you a comfortable holiday beats the efforts of the independent traveler to do it alone. Ceyara Tours also fosters ethical and responsible tourism and has a strong corporate social responsibility program that gives back to local communities.

We have a 24/7 customer service dedicated to maintaining customer support whenever needed. Our fleet of luxury vehicles is always standing by for transport facilities and we as a team of highly trained tour professionals, who are a resourceful wealth of information. Ceyara Tours is a registered holiday company with the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority and assures trust, flexibility, expertise and 100% customer satisfaction.
ourStory.whyFeature1: Reputable and trustworthy holiday solutions providers in Sri Lanka with nearly a decade of experience in the industry.
ourStory.whyFeature2: Friendly team of expert travel consultants who will provide advice with the client's best interest in mind.
ourStory.whyFeature3: Committed towards providing customized holiday solutions keeping in mind maximum luxury and comfort of the customer.
ourStory.meetTeamDesc1: We're not just a room of telesales people. Each of our specialists lives and breathes travel, and has plenty of knowledge to share.
ourStory.meetTeamDesc2: Here you can put a picture to the voice, and learn a little more about them too.

ourTeam.title: Our Team
ourTeam.description1: At Ceyara Tours, our shared passion is the beauty and mystery of Sri Lanka. Our team, based in our office on the island, has firsthand knowledge of its wonders. We're more than just a digital presence; we're real individuals offering profound insights into Sri Lanka's allure. Instead of wrestling with travel intricacies yourself, trust our experts to craft a tailor-made Sri Lankan experience for you.
ourTeam.description2: Get to know the voices behind your journey, from our travel specialists with their favorite local recommendations to our committed board of directors and managers. Whether you're reconnecting with us or seeking specific guidance, Ceyara Tours stands as the premier tour operator, ensuring your Sri Lankan adventure is unparalleled.
